page.title: 15AN OLD SALT
page.content: Mr.G.King was brought up in Portsmouth between the two World Wars. His father was an officer in the Royal Navy at the time, a position which Mr.King later achieved. Portsmouth dockyard was, at the time, the main port for returning ships, and the harbour was constantly a "sea of grey";(The ships were returning after many years abroad defending the Empire at a regular flow). Mr.King's father took his son to the Fleet Review of 1937 which was in honour of the Coranation of King George VI. At the time of the review the Royal Navy was enormous and the review also included many ships from all the main Navies of the World. At that time World War II was clouding the horizon and at the review were two ships from the Imperial Japanese Navy.
